participant_1.background:
I've been watching a lot of tv since I quit my job.
there i m a general of an orcish army.
I neglect my health for the sake of my job.
I live in a quiet neighborhood with my dog.
I enjoy using my imagination to create new worlds and characters.

participant_2.background:
I would love to have lunch with Murasaki Shikibu, the author of The Tale of Genji, to learn more about her writing process and the inspiration for her work.
I love music and I like to keep my files organized.
Last year I played video games while I worked on my masters degree.
the kids will be my responsibility as my husband does not want them.
I remember singing "Intergalactic" with my friends in the car, despite my terrible singing voice.

content.text: The Tale of Genji is my favorite book, but I've also been enjoying the work of Octavia Butler and Ursula K. Le Guin lately. I'm a big sci fi fan.
Oh, I've heard of Octavia Butler, but I haven't read any of her work. Is it good?
I think so! She's a really interesting writer, and she has a lot to say about race and gender.
That sounds cool. I'll have to check her out.
What's your favorite thing about The Tale of Genji?
I love the way Murasaki Shikibu writes about women. She's so nuanced and insightful.
That's cool. I've always been interested in Japanese culture.
Me too! I've been to Japan a few times, and it's such a beautiful country.
I've never been, but I'd love to go someday.
You should! It's definitely worth it.
